snippet: Security officials said a powerful bomb ripped through a convoy of cars carrying the minister, Mohamed Ibrahim, raising fears of a turn toward terrorist violence.
abstract: Bomb rips through convoy of cars carrying Egyptian Interior Min Mohamed Ibrahim, raising fears of a turn toward terrorist violence by opponents of military ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi; Ibrahim escapes unharmed, but explosion kills at last one police officer, injures 10 others and at wounds at least 11 civilians.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Security officials said a powerful bomb ripped through a convoy of cars carrying the minister, Mohamed Ibrahim, raising fears of a turn toward terrorist violence.

headline.main: Egypt’s Interior Minister Survives Assassination Attempt
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Interior Minister Survives Assassination Attempt
